intro: Allantoma torulosa, commonly known as the rough allantoma, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a rough, textured surface. Allantoma torulosa is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
